subject: Technology
title: The Birth of Android
description: One-minute skill: The Birth of Android.

hook.text: Google bought a tiny startup called Android in 2005. Nobody knew why a search company wanted a phone OS.

buildup.text: Andy Rubin built Android as an open-source alternative to Apple's locked-down iOS.

discovery.text: Any phone maker could use Android for free. Samsung, LG, and HTC all adopted it.

twist.text: By giving Android away, Google ensured its search engine and ads reached billions of new devices.

climax.text: Android now runs on over 3 billion active devices. It is the most popular operating system on Earth.

punchline.text: Google gave away the OS and sold the attention.

quiz.question: Why did Google give Android away for free?
options: To ensure Google services reached billions of devices
